item.ptxt: Use the same procedures for the LH side and RH side.
The procedures listed below are for the RH side.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE REAR SEAT FRONT BRACKET COVER RH

s2.ptxt: Fully tilt the seatback forward.
Remove the screw.
Pull the bracket cover in the direction indicated by the arrow in the illustration to detach the claw and remove the bracket cover.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE REAR SEAT REAR BRACKET COVER RH

atten4.ptxt: Use the same procedures described for the rear seat front bracket cover RH.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE REAR NO. 2 SEAT ASSEMBLY RH

s2.ptxt: Remove the 2 bolts.
Unlock the seat legs by horizontally pulling the release band. Then remove the seat.

atten3.ptxt: Be careful not to damage the vehicle body.

s2.ptxt: Detach the 6 clips and 4 claws and remove the back door scuff plate.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE REAR DOOR SCUFF PLATE RH

atten4.ptxt: Use the same procedure described for the LH side.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE REAR DOOR OPENING TRIM WEATHERSTRIP RH
REMOVE REAR NO. 1 SEAT BELT ASSEMBLY OUTER RH

s2.ptxt: Partially remove the rear No. 1 seat belt outer RH.

atten4.ptxt: Only remove the 2 bolts, floor anchor (See page ) and shoulder anchor (See page ).

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE REAR NO. 2 SEAT BELT ASSEMBLY OUTER RH

s2.ptxt: Partially remove the rear No. 2 seat belt outer RH.

atten4.ptxt: Only remove the 2 bolts, floor anchor (See page ) and shoulder anchor (See page ).

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE QUARTER INSIDE TRIM BOARD RH

s2.ptxt: Remove the bolt and disconnect the rear No. 1 seat outer belt floor anchor.
Remove the bolt and disconnect the rear No. 2 seat outer belt floor anchor.
Remove the clip.
Detach the 4 claws, 8 clips and 2 guides and remove the quarter inside trim board.

atten4.ptxt: Use the same procedure described for the LH side.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE ROOF SIDE INNER UPPER GARNISH RH

atten4.ptxt: Use the same procedure described for the LH side.
Use the same procedure for all assist grips.

s2.ptxt: Using a screwdriver, detach the 4 claws and open the 2 covers.

atten4.ptxt: Tape the screwdriver tip before use.

s2.ptxt: Remove the 2 screws and assist grip.
Partially remove the roof headlining (See page ).

atten4.ptxt: It is not necessary to completely remove the roof headlining. Slightly lower the front section of the roof headlining so that the back window glass can be removed.

s2.ptxt: Using a knife, cut off the moulding as shown in the illustration.

atten3.ptxt: Be careful not to damage the vehicle body.

s2.ptxt: Remove the remaining moulding.

atten4.ptxt: Make a partial cut in the moulding. Then pull and remove it by hand.
Apply protective tape to the outer surface of the vehicle body to prevent scratches.

atten3.ptxt: When separating the quarter window glass from the vehicle, be careful not to damage the vehicle's paint or interior/exterior ornaments.

s2.ptxt: Disconnect the connector.
From the interior, insert a piano wire between the vehicle body and the quarter window glass as shown in the illustration.
Tie objects that can serve as handles (for example, wooden blocks) to both wire ends.
Cut through the adhesive by pulling the piano wire around the quarter window glass.

atten3.ptxt: Leave as much adhesive on the vehicle body as possible when removing the quarter window glass.

s2.ptxt: Using suction cups, remove the quarter window glass.
Clean the outer edges of the glass with white gasoline.

item.ptxt: Do not touch the glass surface after cleaning it.
Be careful not to damage the glass.
Ever if using new glass, clean the glass with white gasoline.

s2.ptxt: Clean and shape the contact surface of the vehicle body.

s3.ptxt: On the contact surface of the vehicle body, use a knife to cut away excess adhesive as shown in the illustration.

atten4.ptxt: Leave as much adhesive on the vehicle body as possible.

atten3.ptxt: Be careful not to damage the vehicle body.

s3.ptxt: Clean the contact surface of the vehicle body with cleaner.

atten4.ptxt: Even if all the adhesive has been removed, clean the vehicle body.
